description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-37988), apply the relevant KB updates based on your Windows version:

1. For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040442.
2. For Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040442.
3. For Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040431.
4. For Windows 10 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040448.
5. For Windows 10 (32-bit Systems), apply KB5040448.
6. For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040427.
7. For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64-based Systems), apply KB5040427.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses an improper handling of length parameter inconsistency issue that could lead to a security feature bypass.
- The relevant KB articles can be found at the following links:
  - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
  - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)
  - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
  - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is running a supported version of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
